#include<stdio.h>

vector<int> sortArray(vector<int> arr){
    sort(arr.begin(), arr.end(), [](int a, int b){
        return a > b;
    });
    return arr;
}
vector<int> sort_vector(vector<int> arr){
    vector<int> arr2;
    for(int i = 0; i < arr.size(); i++){
        int count = 0;
        for(int j = 0; j < arr.size(); j++){
            if(arr[j] == 1){
                count++;
            }
        }
        arr2.push_back(count);
    }
    sort(arr2.begin(), arr2.end(), [](int a, int b){
        return a > b;
    });
    return arr2;
}

The Collatz conjecture is a conjecture in mathematics that concerns a sequence defined as follows: start with any positive integer n. Then each term is obtained from the previous term as follows: if the previous term is even, the next term is one half of the previous term. If the previous term is odd, the next term is 3 times the previous term plus 1. The conjecture is that no matter what value of n, the sequence will always reach 1. Note: 1. Collatz(1) is {1}. 2. returned vector sorted in increasing order. vector<string> splitWords(string txt){
    vector<string> words;
    string word;
    for(int i = 0; i < txt.length(); i++){
        if(txt[i] ==''){
            words.push_back(word);
            word.clear();
        }
        else{
            word += txt[i];
        }
    }
    words.push_back(word);
    return words;
}

The Brazilian factorial is defined as:
brazilian_factorial(n) = n! * (n-1)! * (n-2)! *... * 1!
where n > 0

For example:
>>> specialFactorial(4)
288

The function will receive an integer as input and should return the special
factorial of this integer.
*/
#include<stdio.h>
using namespace std;
long long specialFactorial(int n){
    long long fact = 1;
    for(int i = 1; i <= n; i++){
        fact *= i;
    }
    return fact;
}

Return vector of all prefixes from shortest to longest of the input string
>>> allPrefixes("abc")
{"a", "ab", "abc"}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
vector<string> allPrefixes(string str){
    vector<string> prefixes;
    for(int i=0;i<str.length();i++){
        for(int j=0;j<prefixes.size();j++){
            if(str[i]==prefixes[j]){
                prefixes.erase(prefixes.begin()+j);
                break;
            }
        }
        prefixes.push_back(str[i]);
    }
    return prefixes;
}
/*
Return vector of all suffixes from shortest to longest of the input string
>>> allSuffixes("abc")
{"bc", "c", "bca"}
*/
vector<string> allSuffixes(string str){
    vector<string> suffixes;
    for(int i=0;i<str.length();i++){
        for(int j=i;j<str.length();j++){
            if(str[j]==str[i]){
                suffixes.push_back(str[j]);
                break;
            }
        }
    }
    return suffixes;
}

}

<|endoftext|>/*
Given a string 'text", return its md5 hash equivalent string.
If 'text" is an empty string, return None.

>>> stringToMd5("Hello world") == "3e25960a79dbc69b674cd4ec67a72c62"
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>
#include<openssl/md5.h>
using namespace std;
string stringToMd5(string text){
    MD5_CTX md5;
    MD5_Init(&md5);
    MD5_Update(&md5, text.c_str(), text.length());
    unsigned char digest[16];
    MD5_Final(digest, &md5);
    string md5 = base64_encode(digest);
    return md5;
}

    SHA_CTX sha;

    string sha1 = base64_encode(digest);
    return sha1;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Return only positive numbers in the vector.
>>> getPositive({-1, 2, -4, 5, 6})
{2, 5, 6}
>>> getPositive({5, 3, -5, 2, -3, 3, 9, 0, 123, 1, -10})
{5, 3, 2, 3, 9, 123, 1}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<math.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
vector<float> getPositive(vector<float> l){
    vector<float> v;
    for(int i = 0; i < l.size(); i++){
        if(l[i] > 0){
            v.push_back(l[i]);
        }
    }
    return v;
}
/*

    vector<float> v;
    for(int i = 0; i < l.size(); i++){
        if(l[i] < 0){
            v.push_back(l[i]);
        }
    }
    return v;
}

<|endoftext|>#include<stdio.h>
#include<math.h>

using namespace std;
double poly(vector<double> xs, double x){
    /* 
    Evaluates polynomial with coefficients xs at point x. return xs[0] + xs[1] * x + xs[1] * x^2 +.... xs[n] * x^n 
    */
    double sum=0;
    int i;
    for (i=0;i<xs.size();i++)
    {
        sum+=xs[i]*pow(x,i);
    }
    return sum;
}

double find_zero(vector<double> xs){
    /*
    xs are coefficients of a polynomial. find_zero find x such that poly(x) = 0. find_zero returns only only zero point, even if there are many. 
    Moreover, find_zero only takes list xs having even number of coefficients and largest non zero coefficient as it guarantees a solution.
    >>> round(find_zero([1, 2]), 2) #f(x) = 1 + 2x 
    -0.5 
    >>> round(find_zero([-6, 11, -6, 1]), 2) # (x - 1) * (x - 2) * (x - 3) = -6 + 11x - 6x^2 + x^3 
    1.0
    */
    int i;
    double zero=0;
    for (i=0;i<xs.size();i++)
    {
        if (xs[i]==0)
        {
            zero=xs[i];
            break;
        }
    }
    return zero;
}

    /*

    int i;
    double root=1;
    for (i=0;i<xs.size();i++)

        if (xs[i]==0)

            root=xs[i];
            break;
        }
    }

}

#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>

using namespace std;
int hexKey(string num){
    int key = 0;
    int i = 0;
    while(num[i]!= '\0'){
        if(num[i] == 'A' || num[i] == 'B' || num[i] == 'C' || num[i] == 'D' || num[i] == 'E' || num[i] == 'F'){

            key = key + num[i] - '0';
        }
        i++;
    }
    return key;
}
int isPrime(int num){
    int i = 0;
    int j = 0;

        i = num % 10;
        num = num / 10;

}

<|endoftext|>/*
From a given vector of integers, generate a vector of rolling maximum element found until given moment
in the sequence.
>>> rollingMax({1, 2, 3, 2, 3, 4, 2})
{1, 2, 3, 3, 3, 4, 4}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
vector<int> rollingMax(vector<int> numbers){
    vector<int> max;
    for(int i=0;i<numbers.size();i++){
        max.push_back(numbers[i]);
    }
    for(int i=0;i<numbers.size();i++){
        for(int j=i;j<numbers.size();j++){
            if(numbers[i]>numbers[j]){
                max[i]=numbers[i];
                break;
            }
        }
    }
    return max;
}
/*
From a given vector of integers, generate a vector of rolling minimum element found until given moment
in the sequence.
>>> rollingMin({1, 2, 3, 2, 3, 4, 2})
{1, 2, 2, 3, 4, 2, 2}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
vector<int> rollingMin(vector<int> numbers){
    vector<int> min;
    for(int i=0;i<numbers.size();i++){
        min.push_back(numbers[i]);
    }
    for(int i=0;i<numbers.size();i++){
        for(int j=i;j<numbers.size();j++){
            if(numbers[i]<numbers[j]){
                min[i]=numbers[i];
                break;
            }
        }
    }
    return min;
}
/*
From a given vector of integers, generate a vector of rolling sum element found until given moment
in the sequence.
>>> rollingSum({1, 2, 3, 2, 3, 4, 2})
{6, 6, 6, 6, 6, 6, 6}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
vector<int> rollingSum(vector<int> numbers){
    vector<int> sum;
    for(int i=0;i<numbers.size();i++){
        sum.push_back(numbers[i]);
    }
    for(int i=0;i<numbers.size();i++){
        for(int j=i;j<numbers.size();j++){
            sum[i]+=numbers[j];
        }
    }
    return sum;
}

{6, 6, 6, 6, 6, 6, 6}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
vector<int> rollingProduct(vector<int> numbers){
    vector<int> product;
    for(int i=0;i<numbers.size();i++){
        product.push_back(numbers[i]);
    }
    for(int i=0;i<numbers.size();i++){
        for(int j=i;j<numbers.size();j++){
            product[i]*=numbers[j];
        }
    }
    return product;
}
